name: nyu
text: Fancy California meet West Virginia.

name: evilbobikus
text: In West Virginia USB murder devices are sort of the new age way of taking harsh criticism.

name: invidious
text: Holy shit, Nice Pete invented Assetbar!

name: doctorother
text: I was glad to see Nice Pete's quote used in one of the fine magazine articles about Achewood.  His crazed conciseness really makes these strips shine.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: This strip gets ups just for reminding us all of the coelacanth. Treat your self to a google image search today, won't you? Thank you.

name: coldfrog
text: Yeah, and people thought the manatee was ugly.  They have much to learn today.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
people also thought manatees were mermaids, christopher columbus included

also i don't know how you could possibly want to eat one of these coelacanths

name: gormster
text:
Yeah not many people realise this but Christopher Columbus was a fucking retard. Chris is all like "The Earth is much smaller than you think!" And everyone is like, "No, Chris, it's not. It's really fucking big and there is no way you can get to India by going west from Plymouth."
Chris is all "You guys just think the Earth is flat!"
Everyone is all "No we don't, Chris. We know it's round. Everyone has known the Earth is round for years. But there is another continent between here and there, the Dutch told us about it."
Chris: "LALALALALALA I CAN'T HEAR YOOOU"

name: wozzeck
text: A comment left by wozzeck was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by 21echoes, Deusoma, Jar, Fcannon, wombatroop, rumblefish)

name: woodenteeth
text: I charge you with a rewriting. We know you can do it.

name: quinlaenar
text: Except that most historians agree that, while dramatized just a little, his interpretation is pretty accurate. Most knowledgeable people, even the church at the time, agreed the Earth was round and had for a few decades. The people who believed it was flat were your common peasant, not the royalty that Christopher Columbus had financing his voyage. The "You'll fall off the edge of the world." thing was likely used as a "We don't want to spend money on you, let's toss out some fairy tale and hope you're uneducated so you can just shut up. You're not? Well, crap...  Fine, why not? If you DO find a way there, you can bring us back untold riches. And if not, you'll be out of our hair."

name: kaithekender
text: Accuracy chubby

name: chachibenji
text:
Manatees are so adorable.
I would hug one so much.

name: deusoma
text: I imagine that if bean bag chairs were in fact animals, they would not be very different from manatees.

name: greenkoolayd
text: that would be rad.  a beanbag chair with little details so that it looks like a manatee.

name: carlyle
text: they would stare at you when you turned the lights off and know you lied

name: terribleman
text: It would be horrible.

name: greenkoolayd
text: only if one is weak.  manatees are so passive that only bitches can be guilt-tripped by them.

name: curranesque
text: the humble coelacanth may not be much to look at but we all owe them one for evolving into the first terrestrial vertebrates

name: clever-nickname
text:
Coelacanths are big, ugly, difficult-to-pronounce motherfuckers.

SEE-luh-canth, by the way

name: shutup_shutup
text: Yeah, this strip is where I learned to pronounce this word.  It's one of the words that makes me think that spelling is basically arbitrary in English.

name: werthog42
text: I love how he just starts saying that last part out loud; I like to imagine being there, hearing that, and being like, hey, wtf.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: hup! hup!

name: leon_sumbitches
text:
Nice Pete get's my highest honor for this strip.
Although, I think I saw a situation like this on one of those crime shows, i.e. C.S.I.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Yep, me too. I believe it was Without A Trace... this Paris Hilton type was kidnapped and tortured on a webcam and users could vote whether or not she could die. Sadly, if this actually happened to Paris Hilton, she wouldn't have lasted 2 days.

name: deusoma
text: Exactly what part of that statement can be described as "sadly"?

name: jdhenry105
text: HA HA PARIS HILTON IS TEH SUXORS

name: autrepoupee
text:
hey did u guys here paris hilton sux
because i think she sux

name: jhunter
text: i have had whoper

name: norm
text: A comment left by norm was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by eddylee, gbeaton, cailetshadow, achilleselbow, sexualhomeboy)

name: jlynes
text: Oh, I see the problem.  You classify Paris Hilton as "human".

name: gkiyo
text: Actually the problem is that he's getting on his high horse about an internet joke.

name: saru
text: I think he was implying that it would be sad she'd die so quickly.

name: moraiat
text: This is probably the fourth or fifth time reading this, but only now I'm thinking about the implications of what Nice Pete is saying. Obviously he would be guilty for setting up the device, but would others be guilty as well for activating/using/voting for it? Kinda scary...

name: hendetta
text:
I always imagine Ray's last line sounding like.

"He-ate-that-coel-a-CANTH."

name: changuitotuerto
text: Me. Too.

name: stuart
text:
Powers that I want.

1. Flying.
2. Invisibility.
3. The ability to recite the last panel at will at any time.

name: yellowcardigan
text: 5'd for the little arrows that guide you through Ray's beatboxing. And his eyebrows--man, he is just FURIOUSLY beatboxing.

name: clever-nickname
text: Best. Alt text. Ever.

name: farqussus
text: Onstad mocks your entusiasm for alt texts.

name: kreuzkopf
text: Millions of people thrown into jail at once. I mean damn, what if they all get the death penalty?

name: spinynorman
text:
Ever since I read this my trump comeback is I AM THE FATHER OF MODERN DEATH! I HAVE OPENED A NEW CHAPTER IN THE HISTORY OF MURDER!

Seriously, Nice Pete is so crazy every time he's in a strip it gets a 5

name: nicolae
text: HE DRANK A POTION SPICED WITH SAGE AND BREWED WITH AMARANTH

name: pa_ass_nts
text: IEEE? Can I get an enlightening?

name: sigmacoder
text: ---> This <---

name: nighttoad
text: earlier tonight i went to see some horrible movie that put me to sleep. however, it was worth the price of admission because they played a trailer for the movie untraceable. that movie is basically nice pete's murder death plan if it were stripped of everything good. if i were onstad, i might start suing some folks.

name: shaneshiner
text: Dude, I saw that trailer too! Before Rendition.

name: usversusthem
text: Man seriously. Way to go, Hollywood.

name: i_love_kate
text: I can envisage that as he screams those last few lines, Ray and Teodor's heads spin around so fast that their necks crick, and the influence of the pot drains from their system like water out of a thrice-used paper cup. Ray's grimace of mortification covered only by his beat-boxin' hands.

name: paco
text: The best thing is the two little hup! hup! thingys in the third panel

name: hellofyellin
text: This strip is now a major morion picture.

name: hellofyellin
text:
*motion picture

Shit.

name: zedpower
text: You may not be too far off. Judging from the trailers, it might be a major moron picture.

name: laserblade
text: It got a decent review from Ebert.  But then, maybe he just wanted to seem hip to the Interwebs.  I...don't know how to feel?

name: autrepoupee
text: Anyone who is reading this from the Future and is considering renting any of the movies that have came out based around Webcam murders: don't .

name: lawbot
text: I believe there is a film or something with a plot based on the stuff Nice Pete says. An episode of CSI? One of the Saw movies? Something like that.

name: ragnarok_engine
text: Besides the newer films that have been mentioned already, that was an episode of MILLENIUM.

name: leggotheego
text: I was thinking this arc would eventually become interactive, with an actual voting system set up through assetbar to determine who would be stabbed.  Then it's a ::insert character:: in heaven/hell story arc from there!

name: salo
text: If you think Teodor SHOULD be stabbed, click page 19. If you think that he SHOULDN'T, click page 112!

name: aghbar
text: I enjoy the lopsidedness of Nice Pete's face.

name: sevenarts
text: I KNEW when this movie came out that it sounded eerily familiar. Now I remember why. What does it say about our culture when Hollywood starts ripping off Nice Pete?

name: yourmalarky
text: I love it when hilarious jokes turn into reality. Thank you movie industry. Thank you

name: jhunter
text:
the... the directors last name is Hoblit.

hip hoblit?

name: sooprmunky61
text: Now they are doing mash-ups of old horror movies, like The Omen   The Exorcist = The Unborn.  With all the remakes of horror movies, I thank all that I can that a remake of Scary Movie has not been made.  The first and all subsequent films of its kin are a wretched and dark curse upon humanity that feasts on the puss oozing from the bloated and infected pop culture of America.

name: terribleman
text: chubbied for putting me in a murderous rage

name: jonmw
text: I am a member of the IEEE, and I am a student engineer.

name: smilebuddha
text: Is your hand on the blade?

name: tonyhighwind
text: This is almost like two strip in one.

name: hyetal
text:
When cruising through the archives on random, I tend to get this strip a hell of a lot.

Just thought you'd like to know.

name: hyetal
text: ...no, never at any time did I think anyone would like to know.  I just said it because, try as I might, I'm just a human being, and I have ego, and I want attention and the chubbies it may bring.

name: 7th_shot
text: pity chubby
